solution_line_template: The curry house previously bought {peppers_per_very_spicy} peppers per very spicy curry * {num_very_spicy_prev} very spicy curries = <<{peppers_per_very_spicy}*{num_very_spicy_prev}={peppers_very_spicy_prev}>>{peppers_very_spicy_prev} peppers for very spicy curries.

They also bought {peppers_per_spicy} peppers per spicy curry * {num_spicy_prev} spicy curries = <<{peppers_per_spicy}*{num_spicy_prev}={peppers_spicy_prev}>>{peppers_spicy_prev} peppers for spicy curries.
They also bought {peppers_per_mild} pepper per mild curry * {num_mild_prev} mild curries = <<{peppers_per_mild}*{num_mild_prev}={peppers_mild_prev}>>{peppers_mild_prev} peppers for mild curries.

So they were previously buying {peppers_very_spicy_prev} + {peppers_spicy_prev} + {peppers_mild_prev} = <<{peppers_very_spicy_prev}+{peppers_spicy_prev}+{peppers_mild_prev}={total_peppers_prev}>>{total_peppers_prev} peppers.
They now buy {peppers_per_spicy} peppers per spicy curry * {num_spicy_now} spicy curries = <<{peppers_per_spicy}*{num_spicy_now}={peppers_spicy_now}>>{peppers_spicy_now} peppers for spicy curries.
They also now buy {peppers_per_mild} pepper per mild curry * {num_mild_now} mild curries = <<{peppers_per_mild}*{num_mild_now}={peppers_mild_now}>>{peppers_mild_now} peppers for mild curries.

This is a difference of {total_peppers_prev} peppers bought originally - {total_peppers_now} peppers bought now = <<{total_peppers_prev}-{total_peppers_now}={peppers_difference}>>{peppers_difference} peppers.
